uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.lifecycle

Class ActionList<T extends DataObject>

  • java.lang.Object

              • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.lifecycle.ActionList<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ActionListener<T>>, java.util.Collection<ActionListener<T>>, java.util.Deque<ActionListener<T>>, java.util.List<ActionListener<T>>, java.util.Queue<ActionListener<T>>, Contexed, ActionListener<T>, Targetted<T>

    public class ActionList<T extends DataObject>
extends AbstractList<T,ActionListener<T>>
implements ActionListener<T>
    A LinkedList of AbstractActions that is populated from configuration parameters. The aim is to remove unnecessary code dependencies This looks in the parameter tag.list-name where tag is the configuration tag for the parent factory. This value is interpreted as a comma separated list of class tags and used to create the listeners. The target classes for the listeners and the factory are checked for type conflicts.
    Author:
    spb
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • allow

        public boolean allow(T target,
            boolean throw_reason)
              throws LifeCycleException
        Description copied from interface: ActionListener
        Does the ActionListener want to allow the event to take place. This is to give the listener a chance to veto the event when it knows in advance its not capable of supporting the operation in its current state. For example veto project setup because there are no machines configured.
        Specified by:
        allow in interface ActionListener<T extends DataObject>
        Throws:
        LifeCycleException
        Parameters:
        target - object.
        throw_reason - set to true to throw exception instead of returning boolean.
        Returns:
        boolean true if operation allowed
